lines.text: You can't swim. I suppose you could drown, though. Anybody can do that. Even on dry land.
Your servant.
Your mistress.
It's so undignified... lying on your back with your legs spread out.
Any flowers?
This is an Anglo-Dutch garden, madam, with French influence. We have progressed from flowers. A garden is a celebration of art's triumph over nature.
We shall be the fucking flowers. We shall provide the color and scent as we walk among the gravel paths.

[on spotting Chrome walking through the wilderness, nude]
Mynheer Chrome, is it you? You seem so... different.
Well, Chrome, shall we make the desert bloom?
First we must make the desert.
Don't you remember? Cousins can do things that other people can't. And we were more than children before anyone knew what we were up to.
Even we didn't know.
Could you lend me a carriage?
My dear James, have you nothing of your own?
Taste, my dear Thomas. Taste.
There's something missing.
Missing?
Yes.
The bills lack nothing. Nothing missing from the bills.
[Chrome and Juliana are talking in the hothouse at night]
There will be flowers of brown and green and black.
Black?
The Larousse collection specializes in dark plants, often black. Primula Arricula. Canna Indica. Tulipfera Nigra. Anemone Atrocarrulea.
I would be unacceptable then in a Larousse collection.
Oh, I think you would be rare enough, exotic enough.
But my skin is white.
Completely white?
Completely.
No blemishes, no stains?
[Juliana shakes her head "no."]
But inside
[Chrome licks his fingers and begins to put out the candles, one at a time]
... deep inside... there is a darkness.
I feel there is. I can't be sure. It would need an expert touch to discover and comfirm it.
Perhaps if Monsieur Larousse was here he would be able to verify.
But in the absence of Monsieur Larousse -...
I am not worthy.
And I might not always find it convenient to wait for the arrival of Monsieur Larousse. May I move now?
[She flutters her fan, extinguishing the last candle]
Thea! Please! Why won't you listen to me?
Because you're saying nothing. Whisper your sweet nothings to my mother. She will hear you. I can't. Good-bye, Mr. Chrome, whoever you are.
Your husband is cursing God. Fortunately God can't hear his blasphemies above the noise of the wind.
I want no more part of it.
For one who so enjoys outdoor activity, you are surprisingly unconcerned for your freedom.

[referring to his artificial hill]
The swollen belly of my pride!

[on finding Thea in the carriage]
She can't come with us. She...
[Chrome grabs him by the throat]
You ever wonder what happened to the real Mynheer Chrome? Hmm?
You're sick, she's not. Heal your damn self!
